alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Perry; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 20 at 11:46PM EDT until July 21 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Bedford County in south central Pennsylvania... Southern Blair County in central Pennsylvania... North central Fulton County in south central Pennsylvania... Southern Huntingdon County in central Pennsylvania... Juniata County in central Pennsylvania... Mifflin County in central Pennsylvania... Central Perry County in south central Pennsylvania... Snyder County in central Pennsylvania... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1145 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sunbury to Alfarata to Raystown Dam to Shy Beaver to near Buffalo Mills, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Selinsgrove, Bedford, Breezewood, Winfield, Mount Union, Burnham, New Enterprise, Everett, Belleville, Shamokin Dam and Newport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 148. The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 131 to 173. Interstate 99 from mile markers 0 to 12. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bedford; Blair; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Perry; Snyder
